IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION AND PRE-SCHOOL THROUGH GRADES 12 EDUCATION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: YORK COLLEGE PREPARES GRADUATES FOR FULFILLING, PRODUCTIVE, AND PURPOSEFUL LIVES BY PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY PROGRAMS OF STUDY SUPPORTED BY RELEVANT REAL-WORLD EXPERIENCES. AS A RICH AND DIVERSE COMMUNITY OF EDUCATORS AND LEARNERS, WE PROVIDE A HOLISTIC EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE THAT GUIDES AND SUPPORTS STUDENTS IN DEVELOPING AND ACTUALIZING SKILLS REQUIRED TO SERVE AS PROFESSIONALS AND AS LEADERS WITHIN LOCAL, NATIONAL, AND GLOBAL ENVIRONMENTS. WE ARE COMMITTED TO DELIVERING A PRIVATE EDUCATION IN THE MOST COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER. WE WORK WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO IMPROVE THE COMMUNITY OF WHICH WE ARE PART FOR THE BENEFIT OF BOTH OUR STUDENTS AND THE BROADER REGION.
IRS990.Desc: The "greater" York college is recognized as one of the 198 best buys in higher education (barrons) best private, comprehensive institutions in the nation ranking IN THE TOP TIER OF regional universities north (us news and world report), reflected by the excellence of our programs, the quality of our 172 full-time faculty, with 91% holding their terminal degree, and the distinctiveness of our 3,900 full-time students400 part-time students'. York college is recognized for the over 1,000 graduates per year, who are competent, engaged professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit prepared to compete in the global arena. We seek to be an innovator and a catalyst for change both in higher education and the broader community in which we reside. To that end York college has invested heavily in downtown York through the marketview arts complex and the center for community engagement. York college has also partnered with the school district of the city of York, a distressed Pennsylvania school district through the York county community opportunity scholarship program. This program provides educational opportunity and scholarships to over 30 promising 10th through 12th grade students who receive mentoring and tutoring during high school and then complete their bachelors on campus. With a strong foundation in the liberal arts including over 60 majors, eight graduate programs and 1 doctoral program. York college achieves educational excellence with a 15:1 faculty to student ratio and average class size of 19 students. York college recognizes its mission when students are prepared and graduate and contribute to the community. Over 91% of recent graduates are employed or have continued on to graduate programs. York College has also sought to be at the forefront of social issues partnering with federal and state agencies on the violence against women act.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: YORK COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL, AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE COLLEGE, IS A PRE-K THROUGH GRADE TWELVE INDEPENDENT COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL INSPIRING AND NURTURING THE INNOVATIVE AND CREATIVE SPIRIT OF STUDENTS AS THEY PURSUE THEIR INTELLECTUAL PROMISE. THE EXTRAORDINARY BY DESIGN CAMPAIGN HAS EQUIPPED THE SCHOOL WITH A STATE OF THE ART FACILITY FOR SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING ARTS AND MATH (S.T.E.A.M.) THE RESULTING FACILITY ENHANCEMENT OPENED IN THE FALL OF 2016 AND REALIZED A TRANSFORMATIONAL, RELEVANT AND STERLING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM THAT EMBRACES 21ST CENTURY TECHNOLOGY PAIRED WITH A ROBUST AND RIGOROUS CURRICULUM. THE PROGRAM PREPARES STUDENTS TO SUCCEED THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES AS THE ACADEMIC, SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND PERSDONAL DEVELOPMENT OF EACH STUDENT IS ADDRESSED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLLEGE IS A MEMBER OF SEVERAL GROUPS WHO ENGAGE IN LOBBYING AS PART OF THEIR MISSION TO REPRESENT THE INTERESTS OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES AT THE STATE AND FEDERAL LEVEL. THE PORTION OF MEMBERSHIP DUES PAID TO THESE ORGANIZATIONS SPENT ON LOBBYING IS DEEMED TO BE IMMATERIAL. ON OCCASION THESE ORGANIZATIONS ENLIST THE HELP OF THEIR MEMBERS TO COMMUNICATE CONCERNS TO LEGISLATORS REGARDING PENDING LEGISLATION AND REGULATIONS WHICH COULD IMPACT THE COLLEGE. THESE ACTIVITIES OCCUR INFREQUENTLY AND THE COST TO THE COLLEGE IS NEGLIGIBLE.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: FUNDS HELD IN TRUST BY OTHERS

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DEPOSITS HELD IN CUSTODY FOR OTHERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Schedule D, Part III, Line 4 YORK COLLEGE MAINTAINS VARIOUS ITEMS INCLUDING COLLECTIONS OF ART, HISTORIC ARTIFACTS AND OTHER SIMILAR ASSETS TO SUPPORT THE EDUCATION AND RESEARCH FUNCTIONS OF THE COLLEGE.

Schedule D, Part V, Line 4 THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPORXIMATELY 330 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES INCLUDING BOTH DONOR-RESRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS. AS REQUIRED BY ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, NET ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH ENDOWMENT FUNDS,INCLUDING FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS, ARE CLASSIFIED AND REPORTED BASED ON THE EXISTENCE OR ABSCENCE OF DONOR IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS. THE COLLEGE CLASSIFIES AS PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS (A) THE ORGINIAL VALUE OF GIFTS DONATED TO THE PERMENENT ENDOWMENT, (B) THE ORIGINAL VAlUE OF SUBSEQUENT GIFTS TO THE PERMANENT ENDOWMENT AND (C) ACCUMULATIONS TO THE PERMANENT ENDOWMENT MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DIRECTION OF THE APPLICABLE DONOR GIFT INSTRUMENT AT THE TIME THE ACCUMULATION IS ADDED TO THE FUND. THE REMAINING PORTION OF THE DONOR RESTRICED ENDOWMENT FUND THAT IS NOT CLASSIFIED IN THE PERMANENTLY RESTRICED NET ASSETS IS CLASSIFIED AS EITHER TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED OR UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS BASED ON THE EXISTENCE OF DONOR RESTRICTIONS OR BY LAW.

SCHEDULE D, PART X, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE IS ORGANIZED UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3), AND THEREFORE IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES ON ACTIVITIES RELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE HAS BEEN DETERMINED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE NOT TO BE A "PRIVATE FOUNDATION" WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE COLLEGE ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES USING A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITY. MEASUREMENT OF THE TAX UNCERTAINTY OCCURS IF THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD IS MET. MANAGEMENT DETERMINED THERE WERE NO TAX UNCERTAINTIES THAT MET THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD IN 2018 AND 2017. THE COLLEGE'S POLICY IS TO RECOGNIZE INTEREST RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IN INTEREST EXPENSE AND PENALTIES IN OPERATING EXPENSES. NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES WERE RECOGNIZED IN 2018 OR 2017. THE COLLEGE'S FEDERAL EXEMPT ORGANIZATION BUSINESS INCOME TAX RETURNS FOR THE FISCAL YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, 2017, AND 2016 REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

PART XI LINE 2D AMOUNTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS FOR FINANCIAL AID WERE RECLASSED FROM REVENUES PER THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REFLECTED AS EXPENSES ON FORM 990. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THE RECLASS WAS $22,759,932
PART XI LINE 4B SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE RECLASSED TO STATEMENT OF REVENUE $95,167
PART XII LINE 2D SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE RECLASSED TO STATEMENT OF REVENUE $95,167.

Part XII Line 4b Amounts awarded to students for financial aid were reclassed from Revenues per the audited financial statements and reflected as expenses on Form 990. The total amount of the reclass was $22,759,932.
SCHEDULE E PART I LINE 3 ALL COMMUNICATIONS WRITTEN AND VERBAL AFFIRM THE NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY OF THE COLLEGE.

SCHEDULE J PART I LINE 1A THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE, DR. PAMELA GUNTER-SMITH, AND THE HEADMASTER OF YORK COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL, CHRISTINE HEINE, ARE REQUIRED BY EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT TO LIVE ON CAMPUS IN HOMES PROVIDED BY THE COLLEGE. ACCORDINGLY, THE VALUE OF THIS HOUSING IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE COMPUTATION OF TAXABLE COMPENSATION PURSUANT TO I.R.C. SECTION 119.

SCHEDULE J PART I LINE 1A COUNTRY CLUB DUES ARE IN SOME PART REIMBURSED FOR THE PRESIDENT, DEAN OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS, DEAN OF ADVANCEMENT, HEADMASTER AND CFO TO FACILITATE THE OPERATIONS OF THE COLLEGE AND DAY SCHOOL. TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS SCHEDULE J PART I LINE 1A THE PRESIDENT'S SPOUSE OCCASIONALLY TRAVELS WITH THE PRESIDENT ON COLLEGE BUSINESS. THESE AMOUNTS ARE REIMBURSED IF THE SPOUSE IS PROVIDING COLLEGE RELATED SERVICES. PERSONAL SERVICES SCHEDULE J PART I LINE 1A THE COLLEGE PROVIDES CLEANING SERVICES FOR THE COMMON AREAS OF THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSE AND INCLUDE APPROPRIATE AMOUNTS ON FORM W-2. TAX INDEMNIFICATION AND GROSS-UP PAYMENTS SCHEDULE J PART I LINE 1A THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE RECEIVES A STIPEND FOR PERSONAL AUTOMOBILE. THE STIPEND IS INCLUDED IN THE PRESIDENT'S TAXABLE AMOUNTS ON FORM W-2.
SCHEDULE J PART I LINE 1B ALL BENEFITS LISTED IN ITEM 1 ARE DETAILED IN THE EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT.

SCHEDULE J, PART I, LINE 3 THE METHODS THAT YORK COLLEGE OF PENNSYLVANIA USES TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION INCLUDE: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, COMPENSATION SURVEY/STUDY, AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. PLEASE REFER TO SCHEDULE O FOR A MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE COLLEGE'S PROCESS OF DETERMINING COMPENSATION.

SCHEDULE J PART I LINE 4 A FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE, DR GEORGE WALDNER, PARTICIPATED IN SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED 457 (B) and 457 (F) RETIREMENT PLANS. DURING CALENDER YEAR 2017 THE FORMER PRESIDENT RECEIVED TOTAL DISTRIBUTIONS OF $15,001 and $251,524 FROM THE 457 (B) and 457 (F) PLANS, RESPECTIVELY. ALL SENIOR ADMINISTRATORS ARE ELIGIBLE TO PARTICIPATE IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED 457(B) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2017, THE PRESIDENT(PAMELA GUNTER-SMITH), CFO (C. MATTHEW SMITH), AND VP OF ENROLLMENT(DANIEL GREEN) DEFERRED $18,000, $18,000 AND $16,006 OF THEIR COMPENSATION, RESPECTIVELY, INTO THE 457(B) PLAN.

ROBERT KINSLEY IS THE CHAIRMAN OF KINSLEY CONSTRUCTION AND A non-voting emeritus MEMBER OF YORK COLLEGE OF PENNSYLVANIA'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. KINSLEY CONSTRUCTION IS AN INDEPENDENT BUILDING CONTRACTOR WHICH SERVED AS THE GENERAL CONTRACTOR FOR SEVERAL PROJECTS INCLUDING THE DAY SCHOOL PROJECT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI - Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Stephen Tansey and Coni Wolf have a business relationship.

Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b THE IRS Form 990 IS PREPARED INTERNALLY AND REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER (CFO). THE CFO THEN FORWARDS THE FORM 990 TO ITS INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM FOR REVIEW. THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND IS DISCUSSED AND APPROVED FOR FILING. THE COMPLETED FORM 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR A ONE-WEEK COMMENT PERIOD PRIOR TO FILING. SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE AS A RESULT OF THE REVIEW PROCESS ARE APPROVED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THE INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM PRIOR TO SIGNING AND FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Conflict of Interest Policy Monitoring & Enforcement
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c THE COLLEGE'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY INCLUDES A REQUIREMENT THAT NO TRUSTEE, OFFICER, OR KEY EMPLOYEE SHALL BECOME INVOLVED DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY IN ANY BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP OR TRANSACTION WITH THE COLLEGE OR RECEIVE A SUBSTANTIAL BENEFIT (5% OR MORE OWNERSHIP IN AN ORGANIZATION THAT RECEIVES $10,000 OR MORE ANNUALLY) FROM THE COLLEGE, WITHOUT DISCLOSING THE INTEREST IN SUCH RELATIONSHIP. EACH TRUSTEE, OFFICER, OR KEY EMPLOYEE SHALL HAVE THE OBLIGATION TO DISCLOSE ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST THAT SUCH INDIVIDUAL MAY HAVE DURING HIS OR HER TENURE IN OFFICE. THIS OBLIGATION INCLUDES RELATIONSHIPS MAINTAINED BY MEMBERS OF THE INDIVIDUAL'S FAMILIES. THE COLLEGE REQUIRES EACH TRUSTEE, OFFICER, OR KEY EMPLOYEE COMPLETE AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT. THESE STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS. THE BACKGROUNDS AND ORGANIZATIONAL AFFILIATIONS OF EACH INDIVIDUAL ARE WELL KNOWN AND UNDERSTOOD BY INDIVIDUALS RESPONSIBLE FOR PROCUREMENT AND REPORTING. TRUSTEES AND OFFICERS ARE NOT ALLOWED TO VOTE ON THE APPROVAL OF CONTRACTS WITH ORGANIZATIONS TO WHICH THEY ARE AFFILIATED. THE COLLEGE-WIDE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL FACULTY, ADMINISTRATION AND STAFF. THIS POLICY EMPHASIZES AMONGST OTHER REQUIREMENTS, "THE FUNDAMENTAL OBLIGATION OF DISCLOSING IN WRITING (TO HIS/HER SUPERVISOR OR DEPARTMENT CHAIRPERSON) ANY RELATIONSHIP WHICH MAY BE OR APPEAR TO BE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST." EACH EMPLOYEE IS REQUIRED TO PERIODICALLY ACKNOWLEDGE, UNDERSTAND, ACCEPT AND AGREE TO COMPLY WITH THE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE COLLEGE'S POLICY CONSTITUTES GROUNDS FOR DISCIPLINARY ACTION, UP TO AND INCLUDING DISCHARGE OF EMPLOYMENT. THE COLLEGE PERIODICALLY REVIEWS VENDOR PURCHASING DATA TO PROPERLY ACCUMULATE AND REPORT TRANSACTIONS THAT OCCUR WITH RELATED PARTIES.

FORM 990, PART VI, LINE 15A THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE IS DETERMINED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR, AMONG OTHER THINGS, "AN ANNUAL EVALUATION OF THE PRESIDENT, REPORTING THE CONCLUSIONS OF THAT EVALUATION TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, ALONG WITH ITS RECOMMENDATION REGARDING REAPPOINTMENT AND COMPENSATION." THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE EVALUATES THE PERFORMANCE OF THE PRESIDENT BY REVIEWING SUCCESS IN ACHIEVING ANNUAL GOALS SET AT THE BEGINNING OF THE FISCAL YEAR. THE COMMITTEE CONSULTS COMPARABILITY DATA OF THE COMPENSATION COMPONENTS AND RANGES OF OTHER COLLEGE PRESIDENTS IN SIMILAR SIZED COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES IN SIMILAR GEOGRAPHIC AREAS. THE RESULTS OF THIS REVIEW ARE DOCUMENTS IN COMMITTEE MINUTES AND THE RESULTING RECOMMENDATION IS APPROVED BY THE ENTIRE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Process for Determining Compensation-Other Officers/Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, PART VI, LINE 15B THE PRESIDENT EVALUATES THE PERFORMANCE OF OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE COLLEGE. THE PRESIDENT EVALUATES THE PERFORMANCE OF EACH KEY EMPLOYEE BY REVIEWING SUCCESS IN ACHIEVING ANNUAL GOALS SET AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH FISCAL YEAR. THE PRESIDENT CONSULTS COMPARABILITY DATA OF THE COMPENSATION COMPONENTS AND RANGES OF OTHER INDIVIDUALS WITH SIMILAR RESPONSIBILITIES IN SIMILAR SIZED COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES IN SIMILAR GEOGRAPHIC AREAS. COMPENSATION OF KEY EMPLOYEES IS EFFECTIVELY APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AS PART OF THE ANNUAL BUDGETING PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: How Documents are Made Available to the Public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, PART VI, LINE 19 THE COLLEGE WILL MAKE THE GOVERNING DOCUMENT, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
